intro: Bredia esquirolii var. cordata, commonly known as the cordate bredia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a cordate (heart-shaped) base. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure species within its native range.
